meanings.definition: A building or complex of buildings containing a number of individually owned apartments or houses.
meanings.sent1: The dominiums in our neighborhood have colorful doors.
meanings.sent2: I live in a dominiums with a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The dominiums on Maple Street look like a rainbow of homes.
meanings.sent4: Her dominiums was a cozy nest in the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The dominiums stood tall against the bright blue sky.

meanings.definition: The ownership or control of real property.
meanings.sent1: His dominiums included a large estate and a small cottage.
meanings.sent2: She inherited the dominiums after her parents passed away.
meanings.sent3: The dominiums of the old mansion was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent4: Their dominiums over the land was undisputed.
meanings.sent5: The dominiums of the beachfront property was highly sought after.
